description.p: makl-tc is a facility command which can be used to easily create MaKL-ready Makefile's.

The makl-tc command accepts one argument which specifies the build template you need to use, and produces a minimal but good-looking Makefile. The Makefile is dumped to the current working directory and is nearly ready to be used, needing just some minimal tweak in order to work.
Once created, you can type: 'makl .help' to get all the information you need to know about available targets and variables for the chosen template.

usage.arg: templateOne of the many ready-made MaKL templates: i.e. 'prog', 'lib', 'subdir', 'xeno', 'include', 'script', 'file', 'man', 'dist', or 'subst'.

manpage.examples:
Create a Makefile suitable for building a C/C++ program:
$ makl-new prog makl > The 'prog' template has been successfully saved to ./Makefile makl > Type 'makl .help' to get the list of available targets and vars.
$ makl .help
------------------- Available targets ------------------- all build the executable (it's the default target) ...
$ vi Makefile
# change __SETME__ to sensible values, e.g.: PROG = test SRCS = main.c
$ makl cc -pipe -DDEBUG -ggdb -c -o main.o main.c cc -pipe -DDEBUG -ggdb -o test main.o
manpage.diagnostics: In case of error, makl-new will bail out with non-zero exit code and appropriate diagnostic message on standard output.
